uk.ac.cam.cl.intelligentgamedesigner.coregame

Class Design

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.cl.intelligentgamedesigner.coregame.Design
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Design
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that specifies design for the level including how the initial board layout looks like, the number of moves available and the objective to complete the level.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_DIMENSIONS 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Design()
      Initialise the Design with a default - namely a 10x10 board of empty cells, without any jellies, having six different candy colours, 10 moves available and the objective to reach a score of 1.
      Design(Design design)
      Copy constructor.

        public static int MAX_DIMENSIONS

    • Constructor Detail

      • Design

        public Design(Design design)
        Copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        design - The design to copy.

      • Design

        public Design()
        Initialise the Design with a default - namely a 10x10 board of empty cells, without any jellies, having six different candy colours, 10 moves available and the objective to reach a score of 1.

    • Method Detail

      • resizeBoard

        public void resizeBoard(int width,
                        int height)
        Resize the board to the dimensions specified. As many cells from the previous board as possible, will be kept.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the new board.
        height - the height of the new board.

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(Cell[][] board)
        Function to set the board layout for this level design. It is assumed that all cells in the board are non-null.
        Parameters:
        board - The board layout for the design.

      • setRules

        public void setRules(GameMode gameMode,
                     int numberOfMovesAvailable,
                     int objectiveTarget,
                     int numberOfCandyColours)
        Set the rules for this level.
        Parameters:
        gameMode - The objective of the game.
        numberOfMovesAvailable - The number of moves available to complete the level.
        objectiveTarget - The target depending on the game mode (see comments above).
        numberOfCandyColours - The number of distinct candy colours for the candies.

      • setGameMode

        public void setGameMode(GameMode gameMode)
        Sets the game mode for the level. Note that you have to set the appropriate objective target if the game mode is HIGHSCORE or INGREDIENTS.
        Parameters:
        gameMode - the game mode to set in this level design.

      • setNumberOfMovesAvailable

        public void setNumberOfMovesAvailable(int numberOfMovesAvailable)
        Set the number of moves available to complete this level.
        Parameters:
        numberOfMovesAvailable - The number of moves available to complete this level.

      • setObjectiveTarget

        public void setObjectiveTarget(int objectiveTarget)
        Set the objective target for this level. Note: this should be set only if the the game mode is INGREDIENTS or HIGHSCORE.
        Parameters:
        objectiveTarget - the target for HIGHSCORE or INGREDIENTS levels.

      • setNumberOfCandyColours

        public void setNumberOfCandyColours(int numberOfCandyColours)
        Set the number of distinct candy colours that the candies on the board are allowed to take.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCandyColours - the number of distinct candy colours that the candies on the board will be allowed to take.

      • setCandyGenerator

        public void setCandyGenerator(java.lang.Class<? extends CandyGenerator> candyGenerator)
        Set the candy generator to the one specified.
        Parameters:
        candyGenerator - The candy generator that should be used in this level.

        public GameMode getMode()
        Get the game mode set for the game.
        Returns:

        public CandyGenerator getCandyGenerator()
        Get the candy generator specified in this design.

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int x,
                    int y)
        Function that returns the cell at the specified location (x, y) if the cell is in the board and null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the cell.
        y - The y coordinate of the cell.
        Returns:
        The candy located at that position (x, y) or null if the position is invalid.

      • getNumberOfMovesAvailable

        public int getNumberOfMovesAvailable()
        Function that gets the number of moves available in the game.
        Returns:

      • getObjectiveTarget

        public int getObjectiveTarget()
        Gets the objective target.
        Returns:
        Returns the target score if the game mode is HIGHSCORE or the number of ingredients to pass if the game mode is INGREDIENTS.

      • getNumberOfCandyColours

        public int getNumberOfCandyColours()
        Function that gets the number of different colours specified for this level design.
        Returns:
        the number of different candy colours.

        the board layout of the design.
